channel.title: I was reading about TShiftStates, but I can't get them to work. :(
channel.description:
I was reading about TShiftStates, but I can't get them to work. :(
Such as when you do OnKeyDown/OnKeyUp events you use a procedure like this:
[code] procedure OnKeyDown(Sender: TObject; var Key: Word; Shift: TShiftState); begin end; [/code]
I looked up, TShiftState on google and got this page that showed me all the possible shift states. http://www.freepascal.org/docs-html/rtl/classes/tshiftstate.html
and then I tried to do something like... [code] procedure OnKeyDown(Sender: TObject; var Key: Word; Shift: TShiftState); begin if(Shift = ssShift)Then WriteLn('Shift is down'); end; [/code]
but that just returned errors. :(

item.title: I was reading about TShiftStates, but I can't get them to work. :(
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Well… it’s defined as:

TShiftState = set of (ssShift, ssAlt, ssCtrl, ssLeft, ssRight, ssMiddle, ssDouble);

So it’s a set of such. Meaning that you’d have do do something like this:

procedure OnKeyDown(Sender: TObject; var Key: Word; Shift: TShiftState); begin if(Shift = [ssShift])Then WriteLn('Shift is down'); end;
Although, technically, it should be:

if ssShift in Shift then ...

So that it doesn’t only when when shift, and shift alone is, pressed.
But since that doesn’t work in SCAR, you’d have to loop through all elements of Shift, I suppose, to make sure at least one of them is ssShift.
